page.title: 19Trade and Shops
page.content: It is an interesting trend of the mid 1980's that the village shop and post office at Iwade, the post office and newsagents at Grovehurst, the village store at Quinton and the general store at Kemsley are all owned by a person named PATEL. These shops are often open all hours and provide a valuable service to the communities they serve. Depite this it is thought that the prices charged by these shops are expensive because they have no competition. In Iwade tucked away in numerous little sheds are car repair units which are always very busy. A very popular fruit, produce and garden centre dominates the centre of Iwade and next to this is a cafe and fish bar owned by the same person. Bobbing has no shops but a small workshop manufactures garden sheds in a farm building
